channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:

item.title: Cross of St George attached to lampost opposite mosque., 25th September
item.description:
The only flag on a lampost in Sidcup is placed opposite the mosque. This is clearly intimidatory. It has gone up just in time for the holy day. If you don't think this will raise community tension, I would like to know what you think will.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light column not working, 25th September
item.description:
Light column C154 is not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White lines on the road need remarking, 25th September
item.description:
The white parking bay lines in our road haven’t been repainted since they were first introduced and are now almost invisible. People are parking all down the road and near to driveways making it hard to get in and out of drives and impossible for emergency vehicles to access the road given the bend in the road near kings hall road end of street
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reddons Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light column & bollards unlit, 25th September
item.description:
The lighting for column C202 and both bollards on the crossing island is not working. Seems to be a recurring issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and cigarette buds, 25th September
item.description:
There is a significant build-up of litter and cigarette butts across the Maida Hill Market area. The pavements and seating areas look dirty and neglected, and the floor and benches need a proper scrub. This makes the space unpleasant for residents and visitors. The issue has been ongoing for several weeks without visible improvement, and regular cleaning and maintenance are needed to prevent it from returning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Lighting in Blissett Street, 25th September
item.description:
As the nights get darker earlier, I notice that the street lighting is quite poor along Blissett Street where the houses are opposite the Fire Station. Can something be done on this as it does not feel as safe walking along here when there are huge gaps in lighting along much of this street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1 - 14, Greenwich South Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Workmen left latge plastic fencing, 25th September
item.description:

item.title: What is the mayor of Hackney doing about this inconvenience the cut through mare Street to Tesco's has been closed off causing elderly and vulnerable people have to walk the long way around who are very unwell and have mobility issues.Disabled access alleyway needs to be reopened ASAP. This is disgraceful vulnerable and elderly people., 25th September
item.description:
Key access route for vulnerable elderly people and disable motability users has been closed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
